title: Human Augmented Sensor
description: We develop advanced sensors that augment human sensory capabilities, including acoustic, tactile, and ultrasonic sensing technologies. Our research focuses on creating self-powered sensors that can seamlessly integrate with the human body for healthcare monitoring and human-machine interfaces.

topics.title: Auditory Sensors
topics.description: Biomimetic piezoelectric acoustic sensors for speech recognition and hearing augmentation

topics.title: Tactile Sensors
topics.description: High-sensitivity pressure sensors for wearable blood pressure monitoring and skin electronics

topics.title: Ultrasonic Sensors
topics.description: Flexible ultrasound devices for medical imaging and therapeutic applications

topics.title: Self-powered Energy
topics.description: Nanogenerators and energy harvesting systems for autonomous sensor operation

title: Neuromorphic AI
description: Our neuromorphic research aims to develop brain-inspired computing systems using memristive devices. We focus on creating hardware implementations of artificial synapses and neurons that can process information more efficiently than conventional computing architectures.

topics.title: Neuromorphic Computing
topics.description: Memristive synapse devices for hardware neural networks and in-memory computing

topics.title: AI-assisted Skin Sensor
topics.description: Integration of AI algorithms with wearable sensors for intelligent health monitoring

topics.title: AI-Brain Interface
topics.description: Neural interface devices for brain-machine communication and neurostimulation

topics.title: 3D Monolithic Integration
topics.description: Three-dimensional integration of neuromorphic devices for high-density computing

title: Human Electronics
description: We pioneer the development of soft, flexible electronics that can conform to the human body. Our research encompasses bio-integrated devices, therapeutic light-emitting systems, and laser-processed electronics for next-generation wearable and implantable applications.

topics.title: Bio-integrated Soft Electronics
topics.description: Flexible and stretchable electronic devices for seamless body integration

topics.title: Augmented Optoelectronics
topics.description: MicroLED-based therapeutic devices for photodynamic therapy and skin treatment

topics.title: Laser-induced Electronics
topics.description: Laser processing techniques for fabricating flexible electronic devices

topics.title: Implantable Devices
topics.description: Deep-tissue implantable electronics for cancer therapy and neural stimulation
